meanings.definition: The amount that fills or would fill a head.
meanings.sent1: She had a headful of dreams and aspirations.
meanings.sent2: The jar was a headful of marbles.
meanings.sent3: His headful of worries kept him up at night.
meanings.sent4: The library was a headful of knowledge waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a headful of colorful flowers swaying in the breeze.

meanings.definition: A mind full of thoughts or ideas.
meanings.sent1: Her headful of memories brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent2: The artist had a headful of creative inspiration.
meanings.sent3: His headful of plans for the weekend made him excited.
meanings.sent4: The inventor's headful of inventions changed the world.
meanings.sent5: The writer's headful of stories flowed onto the pages effortlessly.
